user_review: Real & good authentic Thai food.We tried the delivery before the re-open during pandemic & the food was really good.

I have been reviewing this everywhere I can because they're just that good. I sent them a nice note on my delivery order during Covid 19 (yes, they're open!) and they sent me back a lovely bag covered in notes, with extra goodies inside! Their mango sticky rice was an absolute stand out, and the vegetarian Pad Thai and pineapple rice were excellent as well. Excellent food, excellent customer service. Can't wait to try their cocktail menu once this whole thing is over with!

Pamika was my last restaurant meal before covid-19 measures took place. I really enjoyed their food but unfortunately their service was off that night.Cocktails were excellent, definitely worth ordering! Anyone that loves spicy food is going to love Pamika. Their papaya salad was super spicy and delicious. We ordered the chicken brochettes were really good, they were on he sweet side and balanced out the rest of our spicy meal well. Our favorite dish was the chicken curry, it was spicy, creamy and umami. I would order it again and again! Pad Thai was also good but nothing special.Service wasn't great that evening. The staff was friendly but they weren't attentive. They brought us the green curry to share but without any bowls and it took us at least 10 min to get someone's attention. We also needed a spoon and another napkin at some point and couldn't flag anyone down. They were really busy that evening, probably an off night

Impressed once again at this trendy yet authentic Thai restaurant. We shared : Tom ka soup : flavourful coconut / ginger / lemongrass / chicken /soup. Perfect for hot weather 5/5Shrimp pad Thai: always delicious here. Flavours are balanced and noodles are al dente 5/5Beef Penang red curry: thick creamy sauce with thin beef slices. 5/5 Lived in Thailand for 18 years and this took me back home. Would recommend for sure.

Very much enjoyed my meal (delivered)! - Vegetarian Tom Kha 3.5/5- Beef Panaeng 4/5- Chicken Green Curry 4.5/5- Rice 4.5/5The Tom Kha felt like it lacked a bit of depth, but generous amount of vegetables and tofu. The Beef Panaeng was tasty, wish there was a bit more vegetables. The Chicken Green curry was unique, loved the winter melon! This was my favorite. Would have liked extra vegetables. The rice & consistency was good! Will order again and explore the menu. It is promising!

Easily the BEST Thai I've had in Montreal - but so expensive?!?I paid about $25 for a rendang beef that was so good that I would take a bath in the sauce, but even for the best rendang beef I've had in my life, TWENTY FIVE DOLLARS is an insanely high cost to pay. It wasn't even that much beef - I'd say a normal amount, it wasn't stingy, but for $25... idk, I would expect a whole damn steak for that, and it definitely wasn't  And it didn't even come with rice!But let's talk about the rest of it. I was introduced to riceberry rice, since it came free with my order, and it was FAN. TASTIC. A little crunchy, a little chewy, extremely savoury and sweet at the same time - I can't wait to try it again. I would even be tempted to order extra to use in a salad the next day. A friend of mine basically DEMANDED that I try the mango and coconut sticky rice dessert, and he was right. You NEED to try this. The softness of the fresh mango mixed with the sticky rice texture, and topped with a light, sweet coconut sauce - if your mouth isn't already watering, you may be dead. Or allergic to one of the ingredients. Or maybe not a dessert person. I won't judge. Honestly, I love love LOVE this place, I just think that it's one of the most egregiously expensive restaurants in Montreal, so I'm saving it for special occasions. But I'm excited to get to try it again when I can!

I tried Pamika Thai before trying Mae Sri (another one of the Chef's restaurants) and it was why I was so excited for Mae Sri. This place is great! The decor is gorgeous, especially in the summer when you're seated on the terrace and enveloped by the wood structures and beautiful trees. On top of the amazing ambiance, their food is delicious. This was my first time trying green curry and my oh my oh my! It was out of this world. The flavour is completely different from anything I've ever tasted. But it is so incredibly delicious. The mixture of coconut milk and curry paste is comforting but exciting at the same time (not even sure if that makes any sense??). I've been so intrigued with this dish that I've gotten it three times in the last month (that gives you an idea of how good it is!!). All in all, the portion sizes are great, the service was fast, the servers are really sweet, and the food is incredible. The drinks are a bit funky, but I think it's because I'm not used to these types of flavours. Out of all the drinks, I recommend the one with the pineapple (I forget the name). Needless to say, go here!

I am overall so very impressed by Pamika. This was a great referral by friends who have stopped by in Montreal.AMBIANCE: 4/5I love how the restaurant is decorated and the vibes it gives off. The interior is dim but has authentic (looking) designs around the restaurant. I was comfortable in seating, with the tables being clean and other parties further apart (no overcrowding here!)FOOD: 5/5We ordered:1. Chicken Satay: The chicken was great quality, gently charred, and the dipping sauces were A+. 2. Pad Thai: I LOVED this. The pad thai was delicious. It was tasty without being saucy. There was a generous amount of chicken. Tip: SQUEEZE THE LEMON.3. Pineapple Fried Rice: Lots of pineapple and chicken in the dish. They serve it to you in pineapple that's split in half. SERVICE: 5/5The servers here are so friendly! Speaking both French & English it was easy to communicate. Our server was also the bartender and right away he told us if we needed anything we just need to wave to him at the bar - which we didn't because he diligently checked up on us.What was outstanding though was the manner the manager handled a disgruntled party. There was a table quite close to us (and quite loud) that had problems starting from when they were being seated down. The original waiter had so much difficulty with them that the manager took over. She was patient and calm, while working towards a resolution (including seating problems, misunderstanding the menu)OVERALL; 5/5This will be a main stop for me when I head back up to Montreal again. MAKE RESERVATIONS.

Looking for authentic, delicious, we'll balanced made with love Thai food...this is your spot. I highly recommend ordering a bunch of dishes and sharing to try as much as you can since everything was tasty. Service was great, portions were generous, wasn't too expensive, not pretentious, family friendly, great ambiance and original cocktails. Overall amazing experience and dinning.

4.5 stars. Great Thai place reminding me of some of best thai food in Paris. In contrast of the American version, it's not as greasy or sweet and I would come here all of the time if I lived in Montreal. I ordered the Bangkok egg rolls (Crispy and light, the skin is thin, and the sauce is not doused with sugar - fantastic!) and chicken Pai Thai.  I preferred my bean sprouts cooked and had to ask for it twice to get it right. Both are excellent. If you can, grab a table outside on the patio. I ordered the Jasmin tea (tea bag in a pot) - I would skip if I were you.

This is the best Thai food I ever had.  They use fresh ingredients and flavorful.  The server is very friendly.  We order papaya salad, crispy duck salad, beef curry, crispy pork belly, and desert we have mango with sticky rice - yummmmm!If you are in Montreal area, must try!

Ordered Penang curry - came in a bowl, as if it was a soup. Lots of watery coconut milk, hardly any veggies and some beef. Curry tasted good, beef was tough, however I was really disappointed by the lack of veggies. There were 4-5 tiny (size of a hazelnut) Thai eggplants and 4 thin slivers of red peppers. Question to the owners, "Since you charge $25 per portion, why are you so cheap and don't add at least 1 pepper to the dish?" I could not eat all of the coconut milk liquid because it is too heavy but I was also hungry. So basically had no choice but to eat all if the rice with coconut milk. Curry should be thick consistency, this was a soup. Sadly Montreal does not have decent Thai places. Waste of money for $25. Tomorrow I am gonna put some veggies in the remaining liquid and cook it again.

i have to modify my review of my once adored Pamika. it was my favorite restaurant in Montreal, but not anymore. first, their prices increased DRAMATICALLY. i don't mind paying a bit more but the most basic soup is 2$ more expensive. their mango sticky rice is now 11$ which is mindblowing. a fancy restaurant offers a fancy dessert for 12$. nothing fancy about mango sticky rice am i right? prices are crazy and it's not worth it anymore. they're famous now so i get it but .. not going back.
Upscale Thai food in trendy decor. More of a dating type of restaurant

Amazing! My friends and I went here during our weekend getaway. I made a reservation ahead of time (it is a tiny restaurant). The inside is very cool, it reminds me of a cave. The service was excellent and everything came out on time. The food here is filled with flavor and does not disappoint along with fair portion sizes. The drinks were good. My friend got the spicy mojito and it was definitely interesting. All of the other drink we ordered were great. Every time I am in Montreal I have to go here now. Also the mango sticky rice is a MUST!

I heard and read a lot of reviews about this place and let me tell you, it exceeded my expectations! We had the thum thai platter which was one of my favourite plates of the night. They also have the traditional thai tea which has milk in it, goes super well with spicy food. The ambiance is super nice, you definitely feel like you're in a thai restaurant. We came around 8:30pm and it was still full of customers.Definitely give it a try, you will not be disappointed:)

My boyfriend decided to try this place i dont regret it at all! I loved the staff they were really nice! And the service is great! Their tom yum soup OH MY GOD! It is to die for! Its the kind of place where you share the food !

We three sisters liked the ambiance here, LOVED the proximity to our hotel, Hotel de Paris, (it becomes the hotel's breakfast room each morning), and found the food appealingly presented, and good, albeit not great, tasting. Decor is really nice, prices are on the high-moderate side, drinks are quite expensive, but are thoughtfully presented. We really liked how a Thai chili tops a few of the bar offerings, which is where we chose to eat since there were no available tables. You can get your meals unspiced, somewhat spiced, and fiery hot. Staff is mellow, engaging, and made us feel quite welcome. So, add a star for that gift.

Very very tasty food. Great atmosphere. Generous portions. A must try in Montreal. The place is a little out of the way but is very charming inside. The cocktails are fun  and the price is right. You must reserve. Also, this restaurant is ideal for larger groups.

The line can be really long during weekend and prepare to wait for an hour! Im glad we did wait as everything tasted so fresh!Slightly expensive but I guess it is worth the experience. The pineapple drink and fried rice were my favourite, while the red curry was good but not as amazing as other dishes. Service was very good too.

If you're looking for authentic Thai food in the city definitely check out Pamika! The food is amazing and so is the service. I've been there twice now I haven't been disappointed. Some recommendations:The green curry Pineapple Fried riceMango & sticky rice with coconut milkPad Thai

A trendy Thai spot, it's slightly difficult to find as it's not labeled very well outside. We had 8 people and ordered the tasting menu. The Bangkok delight is an excellent pineapple and mango purée with Havana anejo that comes with refills for 9$ (which is an okay but not great deal). Throughout the meal, we had everything from gyoza and crispy shrimp to roasted duck salad (extremely spicy!) for appetizers. The duck salad was the better of the bunch here with Napa cabbage for wrapping pieces of the duck. We also had seafood Tom yum soup, beef panaeng curry, green curry, manpu fried rice, crispy pork belly. The green curry was the highlight here containing chicken, winter melon, Thai eggplant. Overall the food was good, would rate 4/5 based on that however for a group reservation, we were placed in a pretty cramped space by the door that was rather cold and the service was fairly inadequate in terms of the waitress often not checking in for half an hour at a time and combined with the tight space of our table, the table was always cluttered with finished plates and messiness the entire time. Because these reasons, would have to bring the grade down a tick because of service.
Great atmosphere, inventive Thai dishes & tasty cocktails, would definitely go back.Easy to find parking in the area, and it's best to make a reservation since the place packs up quickly.

I'm not sure what is all the hype about Pamika. The food is good, but really nothing exceptional. Price wise the the restaurant is very competitive, not to say relatively cheap. We had a family style dinner and got to try wide variety of dishes. From authenticity point of view I did not find the food spicy enough, besides the fact that I prefer thicker curries. What really ruined my experience was the table we were seated at. We were group of six, with an original reservation for seven. For whatever reason we were assigned a table that is not in the common area, but a separated area just next to the entrance, which seemed to be underneath some stairs. The table was not comfortable at all, there was no support for the back at the seats, the heating was insufficient and the cold air from the restaurant door will infiltrate each time a customer will come or leave. There were some curtains that were supposed to protect us, but as soon as the food started coming the curtains were practically opened and nothing could save us from freezing. Further to that to sit at the table you have to literally fold yourself. As a result I returned home with a severe pain in my back. Kudos to the personnel who did everything possible to serve us, including bending down in the little area to take our orders and bring food timely. On the other hand this table should not be offered to customers between November and April, when a sufficient heating can not be secured. Our friend who did the reservation should have been warned and asked if that table option is fine. At this stage I personally would not return to Pamika as I don't appreciate food institution that does not care about the health of its patrons.

This place reserves on the terrace which is great !! They have a cute little terrace fullof light bulbs where you can enjoy a nice meal. The food is great! Their soups are amazing ( see some photos in my review). Inside its very stylish and authentic. The only down for us was that there was no more beer of almost aby kind.... so that was a bugger. If not.... amazing !!

Arrived at around 7:30 and the outside made it looked like it was closed but they were open.Small restaurant with nice decorations like tapestries. Price is a bit expensive for the quantity of food but the flavors felt very homey. A good date night place but there is probably better Thai food at a better price point.The pad Thai could have used a special kick, pretty much standard pad Thai. The stir fry mushrooms were flavorful but it was a small entree compared to usual.

Cocktails were GREAT, but service was subpar and so was the food. The sauce on the crispy pork belly was pretty much just oyster sauce, and despite the multiple pepper icons on the menu, neither that nor the krapow were very spicy at all. The rice was also pretty dry.We got an odd vibe from our server, like he didn't want us to hang around (quite contrary to the usual Montreal vibe of dining out for ages!). He seemed very surprised when we slurped down our first drinks and wanted a second round, and then we weren't able to find him when we wanted the bill so we could head back to our hotel. And for most of our meal, he flitted around the tables around us, chatting with regulars. Maybe we were snubbed because we were obvious tourists / not speaking French?

Stop searching for a Thai restaurant in Montreal - I've discovered the best one in town!Came to Pamika for dinner last week and literally didn't want to leave or stop eating! The restaurant was packed on a Tuesday night but we had reservations and were quickly seated surrounded by awesome Thai decor and a cozy ambiance. We were told that the special of the day was a mixed dish of papaya salad, sticky rice, and pork chops so we decided to start with that, and then order two more dishes to share (it's basically a tapas style restaurant) which we were told would be enough food. We opted for the beef curry and the crispy shrimp. The special of the day came out first and was so delicious I could cry. The papaya salad was spicy but so flavorful while the pork chops were sweet and tender. The sticky rice was great to cut a bit of the spice from the salad. Next, our curry came and I literally never wanted it to end. Perfectly marinated and flavored, this is hands down the best Thai beef curry I've ever had! Sadly, the portion wasn't that generous and it was quickly finished leaving a ton of sauce that I wanted to bathe in to avoid wasting but alas... sometimes things don't always work out your way. Finally the shrimp came out - to be honest, I was really underwhelmed by this dish but hubby loved it so maybe it's just me but I wouldn't order it again.Solid service, amazing food, a bit pricey, but will 1000000% be back. 4.5 stars but since we can't give half stars, an easy 5 star rating goes to Pamika. Can't wait to be back!

Finally made it here after hearing how great their food is and being a huge fan of Thailand and Thai food. Basically, everything we had was really amazing from the papaya salad, to the shrimp tempura covered with fried noodles and their shrimp pad Thai. It was an amazing taste of Thailand minus the flight there. Staff was extremely friendly but service was a bit slow. I would definitely go back. Yum yum yum! Writing this makes me want to go back :-)

Last night, we went to Pamika. I was super excited since Thai food is one of my favorite kind. The place is petite but adorable. Our dinner party was 8:30pm; but food was served at 9:40ish... by then the hunger was making few people cranky. Since we were a huge group, the food was served as buffet. The appetizers were the best!!! From shrimp rolls, vegetables spring rolls and seafood salad. The rest of the food were average.The shocking part was the price; 40$ for the small amount food. What was unbelievable is that if you go on their website the group menu goes up to 35$. We never investigated, since it was a bday party and it was very late, and there is a massive snow storm.
Best Thai Restaurant... and the place was really nice!  We have the best time last night. And the waitress is very nice to us
Delicious food and great vibe. Definitely recommend itDrink were good and food had a lot of flavors

Make sure you reserve before coming to not wait 45 min like us. The pineapple drink came inside an actual pineapple. If you want a refill of this drink, it's 25% cheaper. It's better to share one drink and then get a refill. As for the food, we took the shrimps wrapped in noodles as an appetizer. It was crunchy and delicious. For the main, we tried the red curry with seafood and some spicy pork. Both were ok but if you're used to eating spicy stuff, it's not really spicy. The waiter warned us about how spicy the food is and to be careful but I was a bit disappointed. Look for the pepper signs. For us spicy food lover:1 pepper: nothing at all. Just sweet. 2 peppers: ok i feel some tingle...3 peppers and more: yeah ok now we're talkingThe service is awesome. The bartender was very friendly and nice and gave us a free shot for waiting. The deco is dark but perfect for hanging out.Overall, it's very pricey for asian food (you can pretty much get the same dish for cheaper with a bigger portion elsewhere and with a more authentic taste) and it was overly sweet. Although the service was awesome, I don't go to a restaurant for the service but for the food.

The first time we came here with friends and ordered their Large Beef Penang, Large Chicken Green Curry and Papaya Salad. The food was extremely good and service was great. However the next time we went here a day after Valentines and ordered the exact same things, we were given food which was completely different. Maybe they have changed chefs! It wasn't appealing to look at as the Curry and Penang were watery and tasteless. We had asked for it to be spicy, but the Curry barely had ANY taste at all. The food came out after much delay, and even then it was only the Beef Penang and it took them another 15 mins for the Curry. Service was slow, and food was below average. Consistency is key in this business. And to maintain the standards, of food and service both. Disappointed with our experience as we really love Thai and had a great time the first time around.
This is some amazing Thai food. I live in the United States and I would return back here just to have this cuisine here.

Yeah - way over-rated if you consider yourself even just a fan (versus connoisseur) of Thai food.  First off, we were informed we could not get a table at all that night (it was 6 pm) as tables were reserved for those seeking the "Thai BBQ Experience".   I had no bloody idea what that meant, but when I saw the price for 3 at $69 and that would get us an outdoor patio seat on a scenic street in Montreal - I said "Thai Experience" it is! The truth of the matter is I don't think this made any sense at all.  We would have enjoyed a great a la carte meal and had a few drinks and spent well in excess of the $69.  So we get seated outside and I sure am glad to enjoy a nice Thai dinner.Then things start going downhill.  The Thai BBQ experience is basically a DIY experience.  A hot plate, along with lots of meats, veggies and noodles are brought to your table.  Listen, I could have stayed at home to cook my own dinner.  Remember I was dining out DIFM - do it for me.  We did not have an auspicious start as the gas plate almost blew my head off when it was lit. This experience lasted about 5 minutes before I got pissed as I got smacked with water and sauce all over my shorts.  It was bad enough that the ants were already crawling all over my ass outdoors.  I was done!  I just said we are done, we will pay for our mistake (and the stupid restaurant forcing us in this direction) and order a la carte.  Ultimately we did order Pad Thai, Beef Panang, Papaya Salad and Spring Rolls.  The latter two were worthy.  The Pad Thai and Panang Beef were weak:Our waitress Chandanah was great.  She was willing to help including doing all the cooking for us.  However, I was done with the DIY concept and there was no way to recover from that.  Chandanah saved us from a completely disastrous evening.Ultimately several recommendations for the restaurant:- make the Thai BBQ an option only not a requisite as it was for us- improve the quality of the core menu - pad Thai, Panang Beef- do something to get rid of the ant infestation on the deckThe management did take 50% of the price of the original BBQ off the bill.  That was nice but I assure you there was not $35 worth of provisions there.  Again - it's not the money that matters - it is the experience.

nice place with good service. We ordered noodles and pork belly which were ok. Portions were a bit small and taste was average for a Thai restaurant in this price class. The Pad Kra Pow with frog legs tasted great but they chopped up the frog bones. As much as we tried , we couldn't eat it since it has lots of sharp tiny bones and would not recommend it and we eat whole fish with bones often!

I saw an advertisement for this restaurant on instagram & the "Thai BBQ" intrigued me. After some "research" I suggested we go there for dinner and so we did.It was a Monday eveing/night and it was pretty full. They have 2 services so I took the 8pm one when I reserve online. We showed up an hour earlier sinxe it was nice out and they seemed to have a nice cocktail list, we thpught we'd just relax at the bar or whatever.We were seated outside on the terrace and ended up staying there the whole night when we found out that the BBQ is only available for tables on the terrace ( Also the guests who reserved the table outside actually liked the inside so everything worked out perfectly for everyone)The place is very cute. The terrace a little cramped when all the tables are filled but we managed. The inside is very cute as well, would be nice for a date. The staff is very nice, polite and helpful. We could tell it was very hot as they were sweaty but they never lost their smiles and enthusiasm.We had a few cocktails to start with and they were all very good. Then we had dumplings & 3 salads: crispy spicy duck, mango and green papaya and all were delicious. My fav is the duck. The we had the small BBQ which was more than enough for 4 of us and had 3 desserts: pandan tapioca, pandan creme caramel & mango & sticky rice, all yummy.I would come back here to try the other dishes in the menu :)
The food was excellent! Very authentic flavour! However the menu is very limited post COVID-19. Most things i wanted to try were not on the menu anymore

For just a short 2-day trip up to Montreal, my friends and I made sure we squeezed in a reservation to this place. We ordered take-out after not being able to make a reservation last winter, and we wanted to make sure we get the dine-in experience this time. Food quality is exceptional here! We ordered the crispy shrimp, panang curry, massaman curry, pineapple fried rice, and mango sticky rice. All tasty, savory, and rich in texture. Service was very slow since it was a day before Labor Day. Our waiter told us that they were short staffed because they did not foresee such a busy night. All together, we were there for a bit over 2 hours. Heads up: We were told that the dishes are all meant to be shared between the table and it comes in no particular order, so we got each dish one by one. This might be important to keep in mind if you're looking for a place that will bring out all the dishes at once or if you want a plate to yourself.

This little Thai restaurant is hidden away on the north side of Sherbrooke street only a couple of blocks from the Sherbrooke Métro station. It turned out to be a delicious find..Four of my friends joined me for a dinner outing. Reservations was recommended. Despite their Yelp page showing no available tables all evening they did have one large table available for us when I phoned them so if you are a large group call first. Lots of tempting authentic Thai dishes were on the menu. My eyes went right to a glass of Cabernet Sauvignon, the crusty shrimp starter, and the spicy green curry shrimp. Some others shared their choices such as a mixed platter of the entrees, a papaya salad, red curry chicken, fried rice and a braised pork dish. No one had complaints. Several people tasted my curry chicken and thought it was delicious. My friends had cocktails btw which were tall or in unusual glasses and had a Thai twist to them. Everyone who has them loved them (most were Mojito variants) except that one guy  who said his wasn't to his taste. Well overall the crispy shrimps were good. They came on a traditional platter, five of them tied up with a mild sweet sauce on the side. The crispy coating was egg noodles which overall I found good but a bit too thick. The jumbo shrimp underneath made up for it though so I'd still recommend it. My main course was the green curry chicken with rice and it was outstanding.it came in a large bowl with a large portion of chicken and Thai eggplants. It wasn't too spicy either although I'm sure you could adjust this. My friend who had the supposed milder red curry said his tasted spicier. So either way it wasn't overwhelmingly hot but.. it tasted delicious especially mixed with the rice. We were all pretty full after our meals and no one took desert or coffee. They didn't offer any traditional Thai after dinner drink which was a bit disappointing. Everyone seemed satisfied, even that one person who is often critical of every restaurant we go to. I sensed he liked it but didn't absolutely love it which for him is a thumbs up. Nutrition wise, I estimated my meal including wine at around 850 calories based on what I ate. I used very little of the shrimps dipping sauce (likely sugar laden). Shrimp of course is high in cholesterol so beware. The chicken was plentiful but in small bites, probably 4-5 ounces which is ideal. I didn't eat all of it or the broth despite it's delicious taste. The rice was white so not natural or the most nutritious but yet traditionally Thai. The coconut milk green curry broth probably had the most damaging elements which were hard to determine. Cocktails were sugary of course and likely laden with calories. Wine is a better alternative and probably has the higher alcoholic content. So if you are watching over your intake eat ideal portion sizes and just don't over eat. Nutritionally I'd pick this over a heavy red meat and potato dinner coupled with a heavy sugary desert any day. Beware though, add in a heavy cocktail or two plus a desert and that calorie estimate could easily double quickly. Your choices matter if diet is a concern. The restaurant ambiance was low lighting with Asian inspired wall murals and lighting fixtures. The light over our large 6 person table was so large it was awkward to talk to the waiter. There were some private booths available also plus seating outdoors on a terrasse.  Overall though a nice cozy Asian inspired atmosphere. It was also packed with patrons, some at large tables celebrating birthdays so apparently quite popular. Service was excellent. The bilingual staff were prompt and polite and no one messed up any of the orders or the somewhat confusing billing (some meals shared, others stand alone). Mine came to $47 including tax ($11 wine, $10 shrimp, $18 chicken curry). Cocktails were in the $10-15 range. I think. So overall easy to get to by metro, no trouble seating a large group, great service, excellent cocktails, good starters and an excellent round of main courses all set in a nice cozy atmosphere.  Pricing generally matched the quality and quantity of the meals. Portion size is up to you and nutritionally it struck me as generally healthier and with more complex tastes and natural ingredients than you'd get in a steak or BBQ chicken type restaurant.  Negatives would be that it's possibly a difficult place to find parking if they don't have a parking lot set aside for their customers (check first), a slightly awkward large round table for larger groups with a slight obstruction hanging from the ceiling. The table size also makes conversation difficult right across the table but this really only is if you are 5 or 6 people. Other tables were put together to seat other large groups so if you call early I'm sure it can be arranged more to your liking. Lastly their YELP page wouldn't accept our reservation but they did when I called so always call. I'd say go try it and enjoy, for sure I'll go back!

Ok so this Restaurant had a lot of great reviews so i was really excited to try it out. Parking was horrible, we took forever to find a parking spot without the towing sign around. My gf and my bf was with me, we were told there was no tables available. And i can see why. There was limited tables and there were some outside. But it was like 45-50degrees outside we wasn't looking forward to being seated outside. But lucky for us they finally had a table inside open. We sat down and saw a lot of their food platings and it was BEAUTIFUL. The smell was also delicious . So we 3 ordered bout 6 plates of food. We started with the green papaya salad, the papaya was shaved lazily. And i mean it was like thick and big, was not thin and small and lanky like its supposed to be, idk what they were thinking. And the taste of it... was alright. Lots of fish sauce was used so it was salty. It didn't live up to the hype that i was getting from reading all the reviews and looking at all the pictures. Next came the seafood ramen tomyum soup... or something like that. It was EH , i cannot comment enough on how typical the ramen was. It was like something you can buy from the store packaged, and they added like fish sauce and a hint of curry seasoning. Sprinkled with green and white onions. After that, the chicken sate teriyaki or Yakitori came out and it was alright , nothing unique or special. Chicken larb salad, was up next, the spice in it was bitter like ghost pepper, but there was not a good flavor there and it had a bad after taste. Moving on, yum neau was next (beef salad) i have to say this was probably the best dish on their menu. The steak was cooked properly, the salad was sour. I wish i would of wrote the review right after so my mind is more fresh. But i waited a day to think of what to write, so i cant remember what else we ate but it was definitely nothing special or unique to remember. It didnt give me the WOW factor or made me wana go out of my way to come back.I am just being honest, this place is a normal thai place, its not delicious but its not awful, its average. Ive had better. 3 out of 5.Beware of the tomyum, it was def too sour.

Authentic and delicious Thai food. We were unable to get a reservation but got super lucky when we walked in and the hostess told us we could have a table for 45 minutes. What an awesome chance! Overall an amazing dinner with a trendy ambiance. I'll be back next time I'm in Montreal!

Pamika makes really good food. Her signature salad, an understandable best seller, has an amazing melding if Thai flavors with fresh ingredients. The pad Thai, good for evaluating Thai restaurants, was delicious. We also thoroughly enjoyed the pineapple fried rice, served in a real pineapple, and green curry. The Pamika salad was the spiciest of our selections, and the adults in our group agreed it was well spiced without being too spicy at all.The ambiance is fun and eclectic. There is a private table in a cave-like room, a few tables with outdoor seating, a table and chairs decorated for royalty, and a neat round table in the turret area of the building.Service was prompt and pleasant. Reservations are required and appropriate. Prices are reasonable, with our meal coming to about C$100 total for a party of four. Enjoy the meal-we did!

This restaurant has been on my list since last winter because it's the first Thai restaurant that I know in Montreal, so I came there with a high expectation. Since we didn't make our reservation, we are told that we have to wait for a long time for the table or we could sit at the bar. Emmm this restaurant is very popular!!!!!-Pineapple cocktail.I chose it for its attractive appearance, however, when it came to its flavor i can only give 2.5/5. The reason is that I couldn't taste any pineapple in it and the rum was too strong at the beginning and I have to wait until the ice melted and the drink was finally smooth enough to drink. I think adding some pineapple purée will give a nicer and more refreshing taste.-Tom yum soupJust right spiciness and competitively generous amount of seafood in that pot of heart warming soup. However, I was expecting more umami and sourness in the soup to give me a kick. Overall, it's 4.5/5.-Special comboGrilled pork- the best thing of it was that i could taste the flavor brought by the reaction between pork fat and the flame but the pork itself was not marinated enough so it's not very tender. And it became chewy when it generally cooled down. I like the flavor but texture has to be improved. 3.5/5.Papaya salad- Crunchy and refreshing, but the acidity was not enough so it couldn't bring enough freshness after you eat the pork, and personally I think it's too sweet. Good point of this salad was that they added dried shrimps to it so you can actually taste a different type of saltiness. 3.8/5.Glutinous rice plays the connecting rule when you are trying to eat all the thing in this combo together. It cut down the sweetness of the salad.-Pad ThaiI must admit that when I couldn't take my eyes off it the second it came out of the kitchen. The standard that I used to judge if the pad thai is a good one is the aroma of the wok. It's the flavor and smell that a really hot wok and speedy cooking process brought. In this case, it's good enough. However, this dish is too sweet for us thus we asked them if they had the seasoning such as chili powder, fish sauce and spicy vinegar. It became better after we added the lime juice and a little bit vinegar and a lot of chili powder. The bartender who standing right in front us looked so surprised when he saw us doing so. If you considered yourself as a spiciness mania, you can add the chili powder because it brings an aroma that alleviates the sweetness. 4.8/5.Overall, the dining vibe is comfortable and taste of food is on standard. Recommended for those who want to give a try on Thai food and living in Montreal.

Definitely one of my favourite restaurants now. I reserved a table for two to celebrate my birthday and at the last minute another couple who was celebrating a birthday too wanted to join us - we called and the girl at the reception did us a very big favour the night before our reservation and was able to squeeze us in ! She  gave us the best table right in front of their decorative wall. Our waitress explained to us that this is a restaurant where you share plates so we decided to get quite a few plates since we had a big appetite. We ordered one bucket to share between three of us that were drinking on the table and it really did remind me of Thailand. We had the roasted duck salad which was very good but extremely spicy so not for the faint hearts - not recommended if you can't handle spicyness. We decided to try all of the bites so we had to gyoza , Bangkok rolls , the crispy shrimp and the chicken satay. I enjoyed the crispy shrimp's  wrapped up in the egg noodles - was very interesting and very delicious. However as for the rest they were very plain - I would not order again. We then ordered a soup which was delicious - Tom kha kai. Very impressedThen we had the green curry which was phenomenal probably my favourite dish of the night. We also ordered the pad Thai - not impressed and would not get again. We had the crispy pork belly. This was very good too. One of my favorite dishes was the pineapple fried rice - so tasty I loved the sweetness of it. At the end of the dinner the waitress brought two desserts one for my birthday and one for my friends birthday one of them was the crème brûlée and the other one was the mango pudding - both the desserts were so delicious !! I was very impressed because I don't usually like deserts. All in all I would definitely go back very soon - the service was sometimes a bit long but totally worth it.

Found Pamika on Yelp, and it did not disappoint.  I had the Green Curry which was perfect. And the Pamika Mojito which was unique and delicious.  Would definitely visit again on my next trip to Montreal.

First-Ok so it's kinda a bummer how in order to be seated you have to partake in the $69 dollar experience - or at least we were told. A bit fishy as only one other party outside partook in the experience. Second- beware of the experience. It is a lot of work as you have to cook your own meal. When they turned on the grill the flame burst out almost burning a hole in my father's neck. If you come to a resto to enjoy some Thai food the experience isn't for you unless you are a certified Thai cuisinier. Third, so in addition to the experience we ordered some other plates a la cate. The veggie spring rolls very tres delicious(not too greasy). However the chicken pad Thai needed some kick. It tasted blander then bland(so if you order it ask them to spice it up a notch).

This is THE best Thai place in Montreal! It's always so crowded so don't expect to just walk in without a reservation. I went for my bday and the waiters were so friendly and gave us suggestions of what to order. The appetizer sampler is a go to if you want a little bit of everything. Of course we got the pad Thai which was so flavorful. We also tried one of the soups and a coconut curry! Was treated to bday shots on the house AND mango sticky rice

I had almost given up on finding an authentic Thai culinary experience in Montréal when I found Pamika tonight. My colleague and I had larb gai, pad krapow gai, chicken satay and seafood curry, and as I closed my eyes to savour the flavours, I could easily have imagined myself back in Bangkok. We arrived without reservations at 7:30 on a Thursday night, with the restaurant full and looking at a minimum half-hour wait. Instead, we asked if they could open the patio for us, and by the time we finished eating there, the patio was full of happy diners too. Pro tip: make reservations.

Hands down the best Thai food I've ever eaten in my life. If you like shrimp, do yourself a favour and try their shrimp fried rice. I don't know what they put in it, but it's absolutely amazing. The rice just bursts with flavour. I couldn't stop eating it. And their duck appetizer with those leaves. Wow. I'm so happy my friend brought me here.

Wonderful resturant, so much so, I'm back a year later on another Montréal visit.  The food is delish and the atmosphere eclectic and relaxing with helpful friendly staff.  I highly recommend a dining experience here

Went there a few times already. Food is always delicious and plentiful. The ambiance is also quite nice; the decors are gorgeous. Staff is awesome, sympathetic and funny; always available and quick. Convenient location; close to metro, major streets and the LaFontaine park; you can go for a nice walk to digest afterwards. One of our 'usuals'.

Great Thai restaurant in Montreal ! We had the tasting menu (pad krow, pad Thai , appetizer platter, and curry with beef. )Everything tasted great!! Service was alright. I liked how they had mint water. I'm so glad we went here!

One of the best thai restaurant in Montréal in my opinion. They also offer food in different levels of spicy. I eat a lot of spice so i took Thai Spicy and i loved it. The lab kai is a must try. It's a chicken salad that one wraps on a cabbage leaf. Every item on the menu is to share so it's better to come here in groups. The pineapple fried rice and yellow chicken curry is also really good. Im definitely coming here again to try other things from the menu like the penang curry and to have their lab kai again.
Well, this is a first! I was told I couldn't be seated because I was a party of one! LOL. OK? So, no food for single people...well, I say stick it where the sun don't shine! Cheers!

Pamika Brasserie Thai is the best thai restaurant in Montreal. I had the duck salad, chicken skewers, tom yum soup, yellow curry, pork belly, pad thai, and fried rice in a pineapple. All of the dishes were delicious. The duck salad was quite spicy, but really tasty. I believe it was just the right level of spiciness (might be too spicy for most people). Chicken skewers were tender and juicy. Tom yum soup had a lot of seafood and tasted amazing. The pork belly was a bit tough, but I still liked the texture (a mix of very soft and harder bits). The yellow curry was also really good, but i would have preferred it if the potatoes were cut in bite size pieces (easier to share). The pad thai and fried rice were also really good.Overall, I highly recommend this place, and will come again.

-food is very nice, a mix of different flavors! Definitely try the green curry ! Portions were relatively small considering we ordered the larger portion...-service is nice, but rather slow...could definitely improve on it a bit-price is on the higher end considering the size of the portion...

Went for a birthday dinner. The food is great and I love the concept of sharing 5 different courses between all of us, and they're very accommodating of dietary preferences. The food was delicious, especially the pad thai. I find Mae Sri to be a bit more authentic in Thai taste, but this was a crowd pleaser for big groups, and the atmosphere was more "birthday dinner". Mae Sri is for groups of 2-3 for something more casual.Overall great place but a kind of overpriced. Good for special occasions.The service is spot-on and both our waiter and bus boy were on top of it and really friendly. Cocktails were nice but not very strong. The pitchers were really big though and worth the money, they weren't full of ice and juice like many restaurants do it. We took the Tom Yum mojito and it was really good. The Moonlight something was not.

BEST THAI FOOD IVE EVER HAD BY A WIDE MARGIN. First I'm not one to leave a review, but this place demands it. Possibly the best food I've ever eaten, the ambience is amazing, such a cool spot, but the food ! The food ! My wife and I come from san diego, we consider ourselves foodies, we thought San Diego had world class restaurants, WE WERE WRONG. Montreal is just a whole other animal.But back to the topic at hand, we had the chicken pad thai and the pineapple fried rice, it was light, the flavors were delicate and subtle but it was just a 5 * meal. I dont know who these blow hards are saying they've had better thai but theyre flat out wrong, if youre reading my review I insist you check this place out. The place is worth the trip to Montreal just  by itself.

Delicious food and good portions. For 2, we ordered the Bangkok rolls, small green curry (substituted the chicken with tofu) and the pad thai. Usually do not order pad thai, but this was the only noodle dish they had -- and it was delicious!

Authentic and intimate place with great service. Our waiter was really knowledgable. We ordered the tasting menu and everything was cooked to perfection. The papaya salad followed by the shrimp was sublime. Perfect medley of flavors complimented by refreshing cocktails.Great for a birthday party, a date or just a casual dinner

The wait staff is very nice and helpful.  I had the Seafood Tom Yum soup to start.....loaded with big shrimp and calamari. My entree was the chicken green curry also very good. The spice level was 2 peppers but I did not think it was very spicy. I also ordered the limited time Riceberry which had a wonderful aroma. My husband had the Filet de pork special with green curry. The presentation was very nice which concerned me because my husband likes to leave full and not just admire his meal. He said it was good and filling but his entree was a bit overpriced.  We would both go back.

This charming Thai restaurant is attached to the Hotel de Paris, where I stayed for 3 nights. I ate dinner here twice! The Bangkok rolls were great and the Beef Panaeng was off the chain! The Pad Thai was also fabulous! The artisanal cocktails are a must! Twists on classics with an asian touch.

Good Thai food. Can't compare it to anywhere else in MTL but it was fully booked when I went in for takeout so I guess that says something. It's a little pricey for what you get if you are having takeout I think but if you are dining it it may be worth it for the atmosphere. However that is just conjecture on my part.

The food  was good.Very good soup tom kha and very good pad THAI.We didt like the green curry. The restaurant is very cute and beautiful ambiance BUT we had a horrible service,the waiter was rude and very bad.  I was very excited to try that restaurant yesterday but the rude waiter make my experience bad.
Decent Thai food. Was expecting more creative dishes. Honestly not better than the local Thai delivery I get back in Boston.

If you are looking for a truly authentic thai restaurant you must try Pamika. This small resto is a must try as their dishes really take you away to Thailand. The interior decor is simply remarkable and cozy. I would recommend for groups, a night with friends or a romantic dinner for two. Their dishes are truly authentic and packed wirh awesome flavors..every bite will keep you on the edge of your seat. Dishes are reasonably priced and they have set group menu's for groups of 8 or more which range from 35-50$. Would definitely come for more!!!

Service 4/5Food 2/5Ambiance 4/5Thai iced tea (1/5): Wayyyyyyyyyy too milky/creamy, there's barely any Thai tea taste to it. I saw that it was already premade behind the bar counter (looked like spicy mayo) and then they poured condensed milk on top which made it even a lighter orange. I tried it and immediately did not like it, I had other people try it at my table, and it wasn't just me. I told the server I did not like it and he asked if I had Thai iced tea before.... Really? I said I drank it all the time. He asked if I wanted more condensed milk or cream, I said no. So he said I didn't have to drink it and took it away, also took it off the bill. He came back with pineapple drinks for us to try and it was good (that was a plus).Tom yum soup (1/5): This was extremely salty. Like I was pouring salt down my throat. I felt my blood pressure rise by the second. I had to drink a whole cup of water.Chicken skewers (2/5): It was lukewarm to cold. It was alright with the peanut sauce.Pamika Pad Thai (2.5/5): This decent, but a little too sweet. The serving size was a little small.Papaya salad of the day (piquant) (4/5): It was spicy but pretty good. It was a pickled papaya salad that came with sticky rice and pork on the side.Piquant Thai Salad (no rating): This dish was extremely spicy (for me), I only had just a small taste and needed a lot of water. But everyone else at my table said it's good.

One of my fav "do your own BBQ" in Montreal. We had the thai BBQ for 3 people ($69 before tax). It came as a huge portion (could be good for 4 people) with a mix of pork, chicken, shrimps, calmars, and veggies. Also had the green papaya salad, very tasty, the dressing (slightly spicy) is bomb. Great ambiance on the patio, and very nice interior design.
Typical Thai restaurant.Nice decor cocktails are great. Service is really good. Price for 2 is average.
My favorite thai restaurant in the city. If you like thai food, must try it. Reserve ahead for those busy popular days. I loved their salads, soups, noodles, curry and rice!

Honestly, I stopped going to thai restaurants in Montreal because they never match up to the freshness and tangy-ness of real Thai food. This restaurant was recommended to me by many friends who've visited Thailand as well (and whose taste I sort of trust) but unfortunately, this place has also disappointed me in terms of authenticity. We ordered Lab Kai (Chicken Salad), Chicken Green Curry, Pineapple Fried Rice, and Chicken Satay. Lab Kai maintained its level of spicy which I appreciate but the texture did not match the Lab Kai I had in Thailand and other places in Asia. The taste lacked a hint of lime and lemon grass but out fresh chilli which was a good touch. Green Curry was not my favourite. It was sort of bland. I liked the pineapple fried rice, I think best dish among all that we ordered. Satay was all right.We thoroughly enjoyed Thai Bucket of alcohol (we had Gin + Sprite). Alcohol level was good. Worth the money.

This is a preliminary review, I am willing to try again, but here are my caveats. If you are used to great spicy Thai food from the west coast, this might be a bit of a disappointment--one which could be remedied by ordering extra spicy? The decor and service are fantastic--and the reason why I would be happy to try again and add to this review. It is busy though, so make sure you have reservations or are willing to sit at the small bar.I ordered the Tom kah gai and unfortunately, while seemingly filled with ingredients, the flavors were simply not profound and the spice was very flat.I also ordered the Pad Thai, which was a little more flavorful but not spicy at all. Just not like the flavor and spice explosion I have found in rambles through San Francisco and Los Angelos.That said, it is the best Thai food I've found in Montreal...and from looking at the other reviews, it's probably one of the best in the city. And the overall experience at the restaurant is wonderful.

Was I blown away? No. Was it good? Definitely.The dishes are original but I was expecting way more in terms of flavour. The presentation was beautiful but most dishes even lacked basic seasoning, which is very surprising considering Thai cuisine is one of the tastiest and with the most complex play of herbs, spices and textures. I don't think I would visit again.
We stopped for light lunch of mussels in a creamed bacon sauce.  To die for!  The best pot of mussels this side of Brussels.
Definitely my favourite place for mango sticky rice! I also tried their pad Thai and chicken pad kra prow dish. Can't say those were the best, but decent tasting.

We visited during the long July 4th weekend and stayed at the Hotel de Paris connected to the restaurant. We live in Queens, NY where the Thai food is extraordinary. However this restaurant gave Queens a good run for it's money. We ordered the shrimp with vegetables, beef curry and tom yum soup and all were very well done. Whenever we visit Montreal we'll definitely be coming back here.

Small cozy place.  The quality, freshness and presentation of the food is excellent. Best Thai I've had in Montreal. Be forewarned, you will need to reserve way in advance especially it you are more than 2 people. Highly recommend.

First night in town so met friend here for a quick meal before next stop. I like the decor, great for a date. It's October so no outdoor dining. Waitstaff were fantastic. Very pleasant.I had the Full Mooner (Thai Shakes) with gin but I think they were very light on the gin..hardly tasted it. There was a special for the night- sticky rice, papaya salad (hot/spicy) and fried chicken. It can feed one as an Entree or 2 can split it as an appetizer.So we had this and the GyozaThe Gyoza were disappointing. I have had Gyoza's before (even frozen ones from Trader Joe's) that were better.  The meat inside was dry and felt rubbery.The papaya salad was good and spicy but not sure it complimented the meal it was paired with. The sticky rice also was sorta hard...it felts more like old rice vs fresh sticky rice.Then we shared the Vegetables with Shrimp served with white rice. The flavor here was just missing.Coming from an area where Thai food is a-plenty, I had higher expectations and I don't think the meals lived up to what I know as great thai food.

I had been looking forward to coming here after many unsuccessful nights! (You really should make a reservation to come here) Waiter was super friendly. The food was delicious! I really enjoyed the red curry. A little bit pricey, but all in all worth it. The dishes were quite big. The two of us split three and it was more than enough!
Really great Thai food (their appetiser platter plus ginger chicken and red Thai curry) and very friendly service. Everything I wanted, beautifully presented and swiftly delivered. Top class!

This may be the best Thai food we have ever had. We were in Montreal for a mini vacation from Rochester. This place was recommended from our Airbnb host. It was Sunday night and we stopped in for dinner around 8pm. Thank goodness we made a reservation because there was a considerable wait. The restaurant is small and the smells were great coming from the kitchen. I ordered the Panang Curry and my wife ordered the chicken pad thai, of course. This was my first order at a Thai place that didn't include pad thai as I wanted to try something new. I am so glad I did, I have been on a Panang Curry kick the last few months and have even attempted making it at home. This place really is a gem.

Finally, an authentic Thai resto in Montreal!Instead of the usual dumbing down of Thai food with loads of sugar and not enough unique flavours, Pamika delivers the real deal. Anyone can do good Pad Thai, basically the Thai equivalent of hotdogs in North America; big deal. Who cares about backpacker $1/day food? Pamika comes through with the subtleties and complexities of real Thai cooking, with none of the compromises of most local places. The yum wun sen (glass noodle-seafood salad) is beautifully executed, with a perfect balance of flavours and textures. Apart from homemade, this is easily the best I've had outside of Thailand. Their Issan som tam (green papaya salad from Issan province) is something nobody else does in Montreal, an Eastern Thai take on the standard. Some might find it a little too fishy with the prominent "funk" of rarely used Thai fish paste, but they also offer a regular som tam on the menu. The duck salad was a wonderful surprise, scooped up in napa leaves. And their sticky rice was cooked to perfection, as opposed to a gummy, globular mass.Also, cocktails. Wow!We'll definitely be back soon to delve deeper into the menu.

Second time dining here and I'm still amazed. I highly recommend to make reservation ahead (especially for terrace seating) as it would get packed quick. We ordered chicken satay, Red curry seafood and mango sticky rice. All the dishes are delicious and filling! We were two, so one appetizer and one main dish was sufficient enough to share. For drinks, I ordered a Bangkok delight (served in a pineapple ) and my friend had ordered a Thai Boxer. We both preferred Bangkok delight but Thai boxer is refreshing. Our waiter and busboy were kind and friendly, both explained well when we had questions. Overall, my friend and I enjoyed it and we will definitely go back. Our waiter suggested to come in a bigger group next time and try the bbq special (only for terrace seating).
YUMMY!!!! Authentic, delicious, funky place and friendly staff... it's a keeper!!! Dishes we enjoyed: the papaya salad, chicken satay, Pad Thai, and the beef curry (basically everything!)

Hands down, my favorite pad Thai of all time. I normally steer away from ordering pad Thai because many restaurants make this dish on the sweeter side which I prefer it to not be. The spicy level we ordered was one step below the super crazy Thai spicy. I am so glad I did because the dish was truly spicy and we were sweating by the time we finished.The pineapple drink was amazing! It was this cocktail they made inside a pineapple so we looked pretty cool drinking out of it. Tom yum is another good entree to try especially with the cooler weather. I wasn't a fan of the papaya salad though..it was too salty and not sour/spicy enough. Overall, love this place and would recommend it!
The food was flavourful without being overwhelming. The yellow curry was ideal, the fried rice was tasty, and the pad thai was solid.

Pamika Brasserie was very accommodating for our group of 5, and the interior was absolutely stunning. We had a 7:30pm reservation on the Sunday of the long weekend, and they had to turn others away at the door. Being a smaller restaurant, I would highly suggest reservations. It was 100% worth it to plan ahead for this food.We ordered chicken pad Thai, yellow curry, pineapple rice, cashew nut chicken and spring rolls. Everything was delicious, my personal favourite being the pineapple rice and chicken pad Thai. The yellow curry was also very flavourful. One of our group had never tried any Thai food prior to this trip and she loved it! Everyone in the group was very impressed.

The place is small so it would be best that you book a reservation. Also, it was packed when I went thereI've started with a drink, a Thai milk tea. It's not for everyone, they put a lot of condensed milk, but I would say it was ok for me.How it works is that all the foods are to be shared. We had a papaya salad, a tom yum soup, crispy shrimp wrapped with noodles and pineapple chicken fried rice. Portions were big enough for two.Food was ok, nothing exceptional, and service was good. I was served quite quickly contrary to other people. There are not a lot of Thai restaurants in Montreal so I really wanted to try this place. At about 70 dollars for 2 it's a bit pricey, so I would say, give it a try, at least one time.

Went to Pamika on a Saturday night. The restaurant was full. Good we had a reservation.It is a casual place, with a very cosy atmosphere, with wall statues. We were seated at the round wooden table , not very comfortable. The couch was slippery. In addition, there was some delays in serving the food. Besides that, our evening was perfect. The diner was great. We ordered around 7-8 dishes , here are some details. The tum tai salad was so fresh and crunchy. The pad tai, one of the best in montreal. We also had the fried shrimp and spring rolls as starters. For the hot dishes, the chicken cashew, the pineapple fried rice and the seafood red curry where really good. Regarding the drinks, we ordered the Bangkok delight. It is a drink that comes in a fresh pineapple. Lets no forget to mention the impeccable service. The host and waiters were professional. We even had a visit from the manager asking for our feedback and opinion. I do recommend this restaurant as it s one of the best tai restaurant in montreal.

delicious AUTHENTIC Thai cuisine. My boyfriend and I visited and had a great experience.The only thing we didnt love was that they play American music... it's such an authentic play it would have been great to hear some music from Thailand.

The moment you walk in it's got a very inviting ambiance with Thai decoration. There were nobody to great us as several staff/waiters walked by us, so that felt unwelcoming plus i had a reservation. Restaurants are often under staffed. The food on the other hand was pretty good. We had the house special which was the popular combo papaya salad: it was good but because I went to Thailand, I found they were not crunchy but saggy and they put way too much peanut in the mixture. The flavour was good enough. It came with the pork chop in a soy sauce marinade that was delicious, it's a must have. Although we never had it in Thailand. We also ordered the red curry seafood, the flavour was so on the spot, I'm not crazy about frozen squid throw in there but the shrimps were ok, not the wild ones with tons of flavour. I would go back to try a couple other plates. Small menu, easy to order.
Loved our dinner and drinks here. Perfect for a cold winter night: Tom yum soup followed by a delicious green curry and the ginger Boxer cocktail. Looking forward already to the next time here.

There are few times when I leave a restaurant without having an ounce of constructive criticism for the establishment but this was certainly the case with our dining experience at Pamika Brasserie. The warm atmosphere, welcoming staff and out of this world thai food (oh and on point mojitos) makes this a 5 star restaurant without a doubt. Would HIGHLY recommend!

To start off the place itself it's just very cute! Great for groups or couples. The drink menu is exciting and tastes amazing. The food it just really depends on you. I didn't enjoy the assumption from our waiter that since we look non-Asian most things were made very bland and non-spicy without asking us. I've lived in Asia for over 5 years which is probably longer then he has I can handle my spice. The red curry was spot on, but the pad Thai was an absolute fail it was SWEET! Pineapple  rice was also a miss due to its blandness. This is why sadly they get three stars. It's ok to keep your food authentic and just don't have pre-assumptions about your customers we will tell you straight up if we cannot handle the spice !
The taste of the food are good and orthodox in my opinion. And they are able to keep the spiciness of how the food should be.Overall I highly recommend this restaurant.

What an incredible place. Fast, friendly service and amazing food. I tried the Beef salad and it was packed with flavour, good portion size and the beef was delicious. I find many places have tough, poor quality beef but Pamika's has lots of good quality, tasty meat. I'll be working through the menu while I'm in town!

One of the best experience of Thai food in Montreal. The declaration of the wall, the chair and the food are magnificent, it was like in Thailand. The atmosphere, customer service are good. Strongly recommend to try the BBQ and hot pot but they only have it in summer time :(

Best Thai food I've ever had! We had a deep fried appetizer sampler, pad Thai and pork belly... All were amazing! Was warned the pork belly was Spicey but I didnt find it too hot, it was my favourite dish for sure! We tried to walk in on a Friday with no Rez and couldn't get a table, we made a Rez and came back Sunday and were not disappointed!

I would have given an excellent review for Pamika, if it were not for the long waiting, 1 hour to get what we ordered , and the seating, that was very uncomfortable!We we were a group of nine, we arrived few minutes before our reservation which was at 9pm; the table wasn't ready. We had to wait a dozen of minutes, for the previous group to finish. We got seated inside, in the left corner with stony walls, around a round table, which is cozy by the way and looked great for our group. However the leather seats were too high, and our feet were pending with nothing to support them. We were slipping all night long, this was very uncomfortable.An hour after ordering food it finally came! The waiter and the manager apologized, they were very friendly, they visited our table regularly to check everything. Finally, food was yummy; we ordered a special group menu; Pamika Tum Thai (Green papaya, dried shrimps, carrots, fresh chilies, roasted peanuts), Crispy shrimps (Fried shrimps wrapped in egg noodles), Pamika Pad Thai (Chicken, rice noodles, tofu, chives, bean sprouts, crushed peanuts), Chicken Cashews (Chicken, red and green peppers, onions, cashew nuts), Pineapple Fried Rice (Chicken, carrots, tomatoes, onions, fresh pineapple), Red curry seafood (Shrimps, calamaris, Thai basil, kaffir leaves, red peppers, coconut milk).

Tourist trap and questionably over reviewed. Thai express is better and more bang for your dollar. The fried shrimp was good but the pad Thai, red curry and sea food and veggie options were not anything special. Group of 6 not recommended. There are far more better Thai option in this city. The pineapple fried rice was a total let down. And revolving menu with small portions.The service was poor and the waiter was pretentious. Wouldn't go back.

The food was excellent, the drinks were excellent AND unique, and the service was great. They seated us (party of 2) quite quickly even though we didn't have a reservation and the place was busy. We sat outside and the lights and ambiance were wonderful. Absolutely would recommend!
Great service and delicious food.    The drinks are awesome.  The best Thai food we tried.  Thank you.

I came here for the first time with a friend, and I must say - I really enjoyed our dinner! I love their evening menu concept - it is designed in a way you can share your food or ordering for 2 people and more. We ordered a variety of items: the Tom Kha Kai soup - so smooth and refreshning, Pad Thai - balanced flavors, not too spicy and not too sweet, a set of Thai pork chops - very delicious, perfectly cooked, and lastly, their famous Bangkok delight - beautiful presentation for a drink, not too strong, neither too sweet. Pay attention to the spicy levels on the menu... the pork chops plate was accompanied with a papaya salad, which contained bits of red chilis, and I accidentally ate it - very spicy! Their amabiance is nice, but perhaps a little too dark for me. I wish there was a bit more light in the place, and considering for a Thursday night - it was very noisy. The place is relatively small in size, so it can get crowded or full quite easily. Unfortunately, there is no private parking as well, there are some parking spots available on the same street of the restaurant or not too far away around the block. Overall, I would definetely recommend Pamika Brasserie! Great place to bring a bunch of friends and hang out over some delicious food, so worth it!
Best Thai food in Montreal. Request for the food to be spicy. Order the fried items over the curries. General ambience is nice. The cocktail selection is good.

Great to be back in Montreal and finding new restaurants!  This one is part of Hotel de Paris on busy Sherbrooke street and Saint André street.  I used to stay at the hotel which was not fancy but very affordable and a 10-12 minute walk from the main stages for the famous International Jazz and world music festival every summer.  There was a simple, small café for breakfast.  Now, they completely renovated the space and it is a gorgeous Thai restaurant!My traveling companion has stayed at the hotel with me before.  We were absolutely wowed by the transformation!  One of the owners, Antony, was tending bar where we sat for dinner.  Antony was mixing up fantastic Thai cocktails and my Pamika mojito was terrific, adorned with a sugar cane stalk.  My friend loved her drink as well called a Thai Boxer.  My Beef Penang was in a perfectly spiced coconut sauce and the meat was the best I have ever had for this dish at any restaurant.  We shared the smaller sized and priced portion and, along with a very admirable pad Thai, we were quite satiated.This restaurant seems to be getting more and more popular due to word of mouth so I suggest making a reservation.  If you want a delicious Thai meal in a very beautiful neighborhood in the lower Plateau, Pamika Brasserie is a wonderful spot!

Nice thai food restaurant! We had the pineapple fried rice, pad thai, and plat du jour which is set tum thai with pork chops. The pineapple fried rice was my least favourite, the rice was too mushy. The pork chops were very tender and tasty, as well as the papaya salad came with it. The pad thai was good too with their spicy sauce served on side. The service was attentive too! Recommend you to make a reservation if you are going on weekends night. Hope they could expand their dessert menu though. I definitely would like to come back again!

We found Pamika on yelp while wandering through the Village.  We were able to sit outdoors despite not having a reservation.  We had the roasted duck salad and the pad Thai with shrimp and simply stated it was excellent and exquisite. One of the tastiest dishes we have had during our trip to Montreal.  Evan was a wonderful waiter and a great host.  I highly recommend coming here for a spicy and tasty meal!!

With such great reviews, I expected this to be the best Thai food in Montreal. Making reservations online and over the phone seemed impossible the night of and was geared more toward days in advance. Parking was a nightmare and it took quite some time to finally find a street spot to park at. Upon entering, service was swift and wonderful. The interior was decorated beautifully with Thai decorations and there was a dark, romantic ambiance about the place.  Neatest thing here were the candles that appeared to be lighted despite being fake. The traditional Thai iced tea was good but the classic Thai shake was too creamy. Despite having chunks of pineapple in it, the flavors did not come through.  We started with the Som Tum Talay. The dish included a lot of seafood but the flavors did not absorb well with the dish. Also, the papaya was cut as slabs, not shredded, which seemed very lazy. Especially because the papaya salad had barely any papaya in it. It was more like a seafood salad with papaya on top. The Mama Tom Yum's broth was inconsistent even though we stirred it several times before eating. The top of it tasted like water and bean sprouts. The middle tasted sour and flavorful. The bottom was too sour and left a bad aftertaste. The Chicken Larb was just overly spicy and sweet. They missed the mark on this dish when they left out salty and sour ingredients. The chicken was shredded too which was disappointing. Chicken satay and Yum Neau both tasted okay. Nothing in here was bad but despite the reviews, nothing was amazing either.

The experience was amazing. The waitress explained the menu in details. We had the cocktails Bangkok Delight & Pamika Mojito. As meal we shared 2 appetizers: Gioza & the dumplings. We also shared the chicken "Meal of the day" the side dish was the papaya salad with hot peppers. As desert, we had the mango ice cream & coco ice cream. The service was perfect and also how they decorated the restaurant is unique. Better take a reservation.
Delicious. Feels like eating in Thailand. Great variety of dishes that come served fresh.
Great food, nice spot, delicious sangria. Recommend. Pad Thai, appetizers are tasty and not overly strong. Service was attentive but not hovering
Amazing food, everything was very good to excellent. Got tom yum, salad w pork, and seafood fried rice. Very tasty, quick, and fun.
Awesome place! We enjoyed it very much! Reccomend the crispy shrimp and the pineapple rice. However, treat the rice as a side, not a main course as listed on the menu. Good spot for a date!
Loved the decor.  Food was delicious.  We tried the gyosas, chicken satay, pad thai, pinapple rice and all was yummy! We loved the pinapple bangkok deink.

My husband and I were staying in the Hotel Paris, which is attached to the restaurant so we decided to place a carry out order. I got the shrimp and vegetables with Tofu in place of the shrimp and my husband got sweet and sour pork. The portions were large and the service was fast but I have had much better Thai food. There were lots of veggies and tofu in mine but the veggies were cut far too large and there was not a lot of flavor. We were not asked what spice level we wanted and the food was very bland. I would not go back again.
Great food and ambiance. The only thing is that I find it to be overpriced. Other than that the food was great. Loved their tomyum soup and the pineapple drink.

Best Thai I've had. Period. The place has a very chic vibe, dishes are served in share-able plates. Quantity isn't  over-generous as in usual thai places where a person with average appetite (my wife) can never finish a dish on their own. Definitely order one main item per person. We had the pad thai and pineapple fried rice and they were both great. Bangkok rolls rocked as well and their mocktail by the name of 'The Full Moon' was a solid 10/10 too.

Nice restaurant with a friendly staff! The decorations inside are cool the Thai looking furniture and decor almost feels like your escaping the wet Montreal winter. The food is nice I had the spicy chicken special, could have used a bit more spice. And they have a fun drink menu, more geared towards ladies drinks ;). Overall good place to get your Thai fix! PS you might need a reservation!

Would not recommend, although the food was not terrible, the service was horrible, rude and condescending waiters. We ordered a curry that did not specify that the meat would not be boneless. We were disappointed and kindly asked if we could exchange it for something else and received so much attitude back. They agreed to change it to another curry that was boneless but very rudly took the first curry and slammed the second one on our table. The portions were very very small and the bill was pricy. The green curry and pad thai did have flavor but would not come back

The staff were very kind but their service was so unbelievably slow. We waited for over half an hour to get out bill. Food was fine. Ambiance was nice. But I'm so sorry waiting 30 mins between appetizers and then having to wait so long to get the bill is ridiculous.Definitely not coming back again.

Solid neighborhood joint that puts on airs of being the spiciest, most authentic, least-compromising Thai restaurant you've ever tried. Don't believe the hype. By U.S. standards this is very middle of the road, standard Westernized Thai food.  Our bartender repeatedly warned us about how spicy and special the food we were about to try was, and it...wasn't.  Red seafood curry and green chicken curry were both tasty but pretty standard in spite of all the pretension.  There were no exotic herbs or sweat-inducing chilies showcased. These were just good mild-to-medium coconut curries like even *I* can make at home with a can of Mae Ploy paste.  Everything was tasty enough though.  The green curry includes winter melon, which if you haven't had it, is very delicious -- kind of like a watery potato or piece of yucca.  The seafood in the red curry was delicately cooked and not rubbery; both dishes would have benefited from more vegetables and fresh herbs and garnishes.  Unless you're interested in sweet-sounding tiki cocktails, the alcohol menu is fairly limited.  The (admittedly drunk) bartender was bragging about how the most renowned mixologist in the city designed the cocktail list, but honestly, nothing appealed.  We did enjoy some coconut ice cream for dessert, which I suspect is a concession to Western palates and not actually native to Thailand.Bottom line: better Thai is to be had in Washington, DC, New York City, etc. So don't get your hopes up.  This is just nice, average, slightly overpriced fare.

Mouthwatering and absolutely delightful! Their food takes you to Thailand and back in one sitting! Absolutely amazing! The staff, the ambiance and the entire experience was absolutely perfect! We ordered Tom Yum soup, pork chops with sticky rice and papaya salad, pineapple fried rice, and mango with sticky rice.

Great meal at this little Thai gem.  Started with a Tom Yum Mojito that had to be one of best Mojito's I've ever had.  Although the menu wasn't extensive it was obvious the chef had mastered the dishes on the menu.  My only fault with our dishes is they were not quite as spicy as we are used to.   For my wife that was actually was a good thing.Service was very professional yet very friendly. Our server, Daniel, was quite helpful with menu suggestions and at the end of the meal went out of his way to pull together a list of local bakeries for us to try the next day.

I get why it's highly rated.  I too recommend it.  The Thai is good (its at the same level of decent nyc Thai) and the seafood soup as well.   Service was very good, tho my pad Thai and soup came out at the same time (but that's not the reason for four stars - I sparingly give five stars).  Overall, good experience and I'll come back.
Al the food is very tasty and the flavour are perfectly mix. Good service and ambiance

I live on the west coast where Thai restaurants are plenty. Pamika Brasserie is the best tasting Thai food by far! We ordered 4 different dishes and everything was fresh with authentic flavors. Prices were quite reasonable and the service was awesome. Our waiter remembered my  son who had only been there once before and knew his story on how he came to Live in Montreal and that he was from Washington state. I just can't say enough for the place!!

I expected a lot looking at the reviews and ratings but was disappointed . Ambience was nice, but food did not meet the expectation.
